title: Examples
text:
RPython



library(hal9)

h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_bar_chart(x = "cyl",
               y = "carb",
               type = "grouped",
               orientation = "horizontal",
               palette = "schemePaired",
               fontsize = "14",
               tickrotation = "0",
               marginleft = "40",
               marginbottom = "30")









"soon"








RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_histogram_chart(x = "mpg",
                     histfunc = "count",
                     histnorm = "none",
                     barmode = "stack",
                     palette = "schemePaired")









"soon"

title: Examples
text:
Transforms

Assign

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_assign(column = "new_column", 
            array = "data.indices()")








"soon"






Derive

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_derive(column = "new_column",
            expression = "data[columns[1]]")








"soon"






Drop

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_drop(columns = "mpg")








"soon"






Filter

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_filter(field = "mpg",
            expression = "field > 20")








"soon"






Fold

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_fold(gather = "_row")








"soon"






Impute

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(airquality) |>
  h9_impute(field = "Ozone",
            method = "mean")








"soon"






Rolling Sum

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_roll_sum(column = "mpg")








"soon"






Sample

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_sample(samplesize = "40",
            withReplacement = "false")








"soon"






Select

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_select(columns = "am")








"soon"






Slice

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_slice(start = "5",
           end = "20")








"soon"






Sort

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_sort(field = "mpg",
          order = "desc")








"soon"






Summarize

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(mtcars) |>
  h9_summarize(group = "cyl",
               field = "carb",
               summarizer = "mean")








"soon"

title: Get Started
text:
Create a pipeline
Pipelines are a sequence of operations that allows you to import, transform, visualize and model your data in a single web app.

RPython


Using the hal9 package, you can create a hal9 pipeline as follow:

library(hal9)

h9_create() |>
  h9_load(dataset = mtcars) |>
  h9_scatter_chart(x = "cyl", y = "disp")








h9_create() creates a h9 object. All hal9 pipelines will start with this function.
h9_load() s used to import an R dataset into hal9. This dataset will be used throughout the entire pipeline.
h9_scatter_chart() adds a scatter chart to the pipeline.




"soon"

title: hal9: Interactive Data Apps without Web Dev
text: Hal9 helps you build web applications with not web development background to build rich web applications from Python and R. This project is under development in Hal9â€™s GitHub repo.

title: hal9: Interactive Data Apps without Web Dev
text:
Easy to Use

RPython



devtools::install_github("hal9ai/hal9ai", subdir = "r")


library(hal9)

h9_create() |>
  h9_load(iris) |>
  h9_dropdown(values = "versicolor,setosa,virginica") |>
  h9_filter(field = "Species", expression = "field == outputs.dropdown") |>
  h9_scatter_chart(x = "Sepal.Length", y = "Sepal.Width", color = "Species")




!pip3 install --upgrade --force-reinstall git+https://github.com/hal9ai/hal9ai.git#subdirectory=python


import hal9 as h9

h9.create()
  .load(iris)
  .dropdown(values = "versicolor,setosa,virginica")
  .filter(field = "Species", expression = "field == outputs.dropdown")
  .scatter_chart(x = "Sepal.Length", y = "Sepal.Width", color = "Species")

title: hal9: Interactive Data Apps without Web Dev
text:
Interactive

RPython



h9_create() |>
  h9_load(dataset = iris) |>
  h9_slider(min = "1", max = "100", step = "1") |>
  h9_sample() |>
  h9_scatter_chart(x = "Sepal.Length", y = "Sepal.Width", color = "Species")




h9.create()
  .load(dataset = iris)
  .slider(min = "1", max = "100", step = "1")
  .sample()
  .scatter_chart(x = "Sepal.Length", y = "Sepal.Width", color = "Species")
